intro: Pseudosempervivum sempervivum, commonly known as the stonecrop, is a succulent plant belonging to the Crassulaceae family. It is characterized by its fleshy, often blue-green leaves that are arranged in a rosette pattern. The plant is native to rocky and alpine environments in Europe and Asia, where it thrives in well-drained soil and full sun. It produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, or purple during the summer months. Pseudosempervivum sempervivum is a hardy, drought-tolerant plant that is popular in rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its low maintenance requirements.
